com.shopgun.android.sdk.model

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shopgun.android.sdk.model.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable, IErn<User>, IJson<org.json.JSONObject>

    public class User
extends java.lang.Object
implements IErn<User>, IJson<org.json.JSONObject>, android.os.Parcelable

    This class is a representation of a user as the API v2 exposes it

    More documentation available on via our User Reference documentation, on the engineering blog.

        public org.json.JSONObject toJSON()

      • isLoggedIn

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Method for finding out if the user is logged in via the API. It is determined on the basis that the email != null and the getUserId() > NO_USER.

        It is not a requirement to be logged in, but it does offer some advantages, such as online lists

        Returns:
        true if the User is logged in with a ShopGun account, else false

      • getErn

        public java.lang.String getErn()
        Description copied from interface: IErn
        Get the ShopGun Resource Name (ERN) for this object.

        ERN is a unique identifier for objects in the ShopGun API v2, and should in most cases be generated by the server, and not by the client

        Specified by:
        getErn in interface IErn<User>
        Returns:
        A String, or null

      • getGender

        public java.lang.String getGender()
        Get the gender of this user. Gender can be either:
        • "male" for a male user
        • "female" for a female user
        • null if gender is unknown
        Returns:
        The gender, or null

      • setGender

        public User setGender(java.lang.String gender)
        Set the gender of the user. Gender can be set to:
        • "male" for a male user
        • "female" for a female user
        It is not allowed to 'reset' gender, to unknown by passing null as argument
        Parameters:
        gender - Either 'male' or 'female'
        Returns:
        This object

      • getBirthYear

        public int getBirthYear()
        Get the birth year of the user
        Returns:
        The birth year of the user

      • setBirthYear

        public User setBirthYear(int birthYear)
        Set the birth year of the user.

        Not setting a birth year is preferred, over setting a fake birth year.

        Parameters:
        birthYear - An Integer
        Returns:
        This object

      • getPermissions

        public Permission getPermissions()
        Get this users Permission. Permissions determine what access levelse the user has in the API.
        Returns:
        A set of permissions, or null

      • setPermissions

        public User setPermissions(Permission permissions)
        Set Permissions for this user.

        Note that, permissions isn't decided client-side, but should rather be handled by the API/SDK.

        Parameters:
        permissions - The new set of permissions
        Returns:
        This object
